comments.text:
As an org we're sending more events to Amplitude than we expected when we signed the contract last year. Firefox iOS is sending a large number of events (~18% of our total), with two events accounting for 90% of their total - App Foreground and App Background.

We need to ensure that these two events are being fired correctly and are useful for analysis. Is there any way we can reduce their volume?
comments.raw_text:

comments.raw_text: Hey Garvan, can you give any insight into this?
comments.text: Hey Garvan, can you give any insight into this?

comments.text: I don't know why this is, can you re-file in github and we'll get this triaged and see if someone on the team can research this.

comments.text:
Ashley, I've put together a small proposal for how we could greatly reduce the number of events sent by Firefox iOS. Can you take a look and let me know if this might be acceptable? I'm happy to chat if that would help.

https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/firefox-ios/issues/6457#issuecomment-620016133

comments.raw_text: I've gotten some updated info from the engineers that we may be sending foreground/background when there is not _actual_ foreground/background. Fixing that may be a better solution.
comments.text: I've gotten some updated info from the engineers that we may be sending foreground/background when there is not _actual_ foreground/background. Fixing that may be a better solution.

comments.raw_text: Instead, we've removing most events (with the Glean migration) and moving off of Amplitude.
comments.text: Instead, we've removing most events (with the Glean migration) and moving off of Amplitude.
